inBetween.notes: doing quite well

finally shooting up new stalks. the drosera binata that snuck into the pot have been doing much more famously than the primary tenant. I'm very excited to see that a drosera binata var. multifida is in the pot as well!

taxon: Sarracenia rubra ssp. gulfensis 'ancestral x giant'

inBetween.notes: finally shot up a quickly growing pitcher! about 4 inches so far. all of the Sarracenia, plus the single Darlingtonia have been moved to their own tray, and packed with New Zealand sphagnum in the extra space. I am going to fashion an automatic watering bottle to keep these guys always happy and moist.
gave away during the christmas party.
doing great
doing well enough, but comparitively not as excellent as the alba.

arrived.notes: medium size. Super dark purple pitchers, almost black.
arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.
Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: the primary plant as well as the babies are flourishing. they have developed a beautiful red tinge, probably due to the long light I am giving every day. almost slobbering with dew.
looking great, about to flower. I installed a timer for my lights and the deep red seems to have died down.
still looking great. completely slobbery. flowering with cute little red starbursts.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: the primary plant as well as the babies are flourishing. they have developed a beautiful red tinge, probably due to the long light I am giving every day. almost slobbering with dew.
same as the other Adelae, both are shooting up stalks to flower, and a couple of the smaller plants as well.
same as the other adelae. doing great.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: slack potted in terra cotta clay pot, with mix made by Peter D'Amato. pot is approximately 6" bottom diameter and 9.5" on top. height is approx. 9". some sphagnum over bottom hole to block losing soil. trimmed dead stalks away. thorougly wetted with distilled water. didn't have enough mix to fill to top, will have to add more soon.

been largely kept inside to shelter from the cold. put outside if the regular rains dont seem to be coming and sunny out. I think the lessened light has caused there to be less dew and shorter leaves. when bought, it was absolutely slobbering. now is looks less than the adelae, and maybe equivalent to the capensis dew-wise.
was left outside in the rain and cold one night, maybe a week ago, seems to be slowly dying.
'Peter' the Drosophyllum passed away a good bit ago, but I was too depressed to log it.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: have not seen any great growth, but there are definitely small green pitcher-letts. Put up a greenhouse this week, planning on moving outside, as well as the other Sarracenia, if I can ensure the greenhouse is keeping within a good temperature and humidity range.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: Alive, and looks okay, but have not seen any notable growth. Flightless drosophila eggs and media arrived this week, they've since grown into many larvae, hoping they turn into fruit flies soon to try to coax this plant into more growth.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: Doing super well, there's a couple extra pups. The biggest two plants have flowered and are very pretty! I haven't looked up the polination yet, but tried to angle the flowers over the cyclosecta pot in case anything falls.
The pups have flowered as well. I didn't have any toothpicks, so I attempted to cross-polinate with q-tips. I don't think it worked at all.
My friend from the coffeeshop gave me some toothpicks, so I tried again to polinate the flowers.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: Still so tiny!!! Unsure if giving best environment.

I realize now that this plant was in its winter rosette form, I started paying a bit more attention to the watering and two bigger leaves formed almost right away. I am hoping it is transforming into the carnivorous phase.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: Doing a-okay, has made a couple more pitchers.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: went home with Fonda

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: Made really nice big pitcher, seems to be doing a-okay.

arrived.source: Bought on site at California Carnivores.

inBetween.notes: Alive, but pretty tiny still, a whole new pitcher grew.
Gave approximately a third of an osmocote in the newest pitcher that had relatively recently opened.
The osmocote was too much! The pitcher is instantly withered.

taxon: Sarracenia. flava v. cuprea 'BH' x v. ornata 'Bulloch Co, GA'
Sarracenia flava 'orange flower' x purpurea ssp. purpurea

arrived.source: Bought on Amazon with work competition prize money.
Bought at Katsura Garden in Japantown
This was originally bought from FOTGH at SFSU in 2015. Has been in Fonda's care.
Brian Lipinski at BACPS meeting, Oakland.
Amazon vendor. Hasnt responded to species questions.
